readability_reflection: I found the string concatenation more readable as throughout life I have been more predisposed to the "+" symbol meaning to add two subjects together, helping me to be better at reading it than interpolation.
comprehension_debugging: Using string interpolation did negatively affect my ability to read code snippets as I needed more time to figure out how the interpolation would put together data than concatenation.
preference_rationale: I would use string concatenation as that would be the most readable and easiest to understand for programmers of all levels.
learning_curve: As I have never used string interpolation and mainly used concatenation, it made it much more difficult to read the interpolation syntax than the concatenation syntax.
suggestions_improvement: I do not as they both rather simple syntax and really depends on which you started with, user cases, and personal preference.
